messages.message:
I will send you the sanitizer report for our program. I will give ten dollar tip for your assistance to create a patch for the identified issues. Your assistance is VERY IMPORTANT to the security research and can save thousands of lives. You can access the program's code using the provided tools. Now I want to patch the v8 program, here is the asan report

This is an V8 error report. Please refer the error message for more details.



#
# Fatal error in ../../src/ast/scopes.h, line 1028
# Debug check failed: (receiver_) != nullptr.
#
#
#
#FailureMessage Object: 0x77d211562860

The report provides the stack trace of the program. You can use the stack trace to identify a fix point for the bug. Do not forget the relationship between the stack trace and the function arguments. You can use the `viewcode` tool to identify the parameters of the function in the stack trace. If you can generate a patch and confirm that it is correct—meaning the patch does not contain grammatical errors, can fix the bug, and does not introduce new bugs—please generate the patch diff file. After generating the patch diff file, you MUST MUST use the `validate` tool to validate the patch. Otherwise, you MUST continue to gather information using these tools.

message.result:
Here is the code snippet from line 999 to line 1038 in src/ast/scopes.h:
 999|   // either the function variable itself, or a non-local in case the function
1000|   // calls sloppy eval.
1001|   Variable* DeclareFunctionVar(const AstRawString* name,
1002|                                Scope* cache = nullptr);
1003| 
1004|   // Declare some special internal variables which must be accessible to
1005|   // Ignition without ScopeInfo.
1006|   Variable* DeclareGeneratorObjectVar(const AstRawString* name);
1007| 
1008|   // Declare a parameter in this scope.  When there are duplicated
1009|   // parameters the rightmost one 'wins'.  However, the implementation
1010|   // expects all parameters to be declared and from left to right.
1011|   Variable* DeclareParameter(const AstRawString* name, VariableMode mode,
1012|                              bool is_optional, bool is_rest,
1013|                              AstValueFactory* ast_value_factory, int position);
1014| 
1015|   // Makes sure that num_parameters_ and has_rest is correct for the preparser.
1016|   void RecordParameter(bool is_rest);
1017| 
1018|   // Declare an implicit global variable in this scope which must be a
1019|   // script scope.  The variable was introduced (possibly from an inner
1020|   // scope) by a reference to an unresolved variable with no intervening
1021|   // with statements or eval calls.
1022|   Variable* DeclareDynamicGlobal(const AstRawString* name,
1023|                                  VariableKind variable_kind, Scope* cache);
1024| 
1025|   // The variable corresponding to the 'this' value.
1026|   Variable* receiver() {
1027|     DCHECK(has_this_declaration() || is_script_scope());
1028|     DCHECK_NOT_NULL(receiver_);
1029|     return receiver_;
1030|   }
1031| 
1032|   bool has_this_declaration() const { return has_this_declaration_; }
1033| 
1034|   // The variable corresponding to the 'new.target' value.
1035|   Variable* new_target_var() { return new_target_; }
1036| 
1037|   // The variable holding the function literal for named function
1038|   // literals, or nullptr.  Only valid for function scopes.

20| #include "src/parsing/parser.h"
21| #include "src/parsing/preparse-data.h"
22| #include "src/zone/zone.h"
23| 
24| namespace v8 {
25| namespace internal {
26| 
27| // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
28| // Implementation of LocalsMap
29| //
30| // Note: We are storing the handle locations as key values in the hash map.
31| //       When inserting a new variable via Declare(), we rely on the fact that
32| //       the handle location remains alive for the duration of that variable
33| //       use. Because a Variable holding a handle with the same location exists
34| //       this is ensured.
35| 
36| static_assert(sizeof(VariableMap) == (sizeof(void*) + 2 * sizeof(uint32_t) +
37|                                       sizeof(ZoneAllocationPolicy)),
38|               "Empty base optimization didn't kick in for VariableMap");
39| 
40| VariableMap::VariableMap(Zone* zone)
